info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell and northwestern Burke Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Spruce Pine, or near Table Rock, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Glen Alpine, Table Rock, Linville Falls, Lake James, Lake James State Park, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Ashford, Oak Hill and Jonas Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
